Description: Small frame of two fragments from the cardboard black box (with no lid) containing well over 100 very small charred fragments of papyri, with dust; box also contains one piece of tissue paper similar to the papers wrapped around the charred rolls in EA 76499. Also a slip of paper marked '6'. Traces of script are visible, apparently cursive Greek. These fragments were mounted as an experiment in 2009 that was considered too dangerous to continue.
Curator's comments: Previously unregistered. Identified in 2009 in trays of miscellaneous material that had been moved into store room M4. Being studied by Kim Ryholt (Copenhagen).
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: carbonised, fragmented, fragile Black ink: visible with infra-red Red ink: ? Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Box: purpose made with Plastazote padding (with 79723) Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: E
